title: Dinamo Zagreb star Ivo Pinto reveals surprise at lack of atmosphere created by Manchester City fans
text:
A lack of atmosphere inside Manchester City's Etihad Stadium is becoming the talk of Europe.

Wolves are the latest team to visit the best team in England on Sunday but they won't have to contend with the same noise City's opponents faced at the old Maine Road, even when they slipped to the old third division.

'It was a quiet stadium and that surprised us,' said Dinamo Zagreb's Ivo Pinto, who spent three years at Norwich City and returned to England last week when his side met City in the Champion League.

Dinamo Zagreb's Ivo Ponto has revealed his surprise at the lack of atmosphere at the Etihad

Pinto says he expected more from City's supporters in last week's Champions League clash

City boss Pep Guardiola has previously urged City fans to create more noise at home games

'Our fans were fantastic but the home supporters were quiet. It won't be the same in Zagreb. It will be a different atmosphere.

'We will have 35,000 fans there behind us and there will be great passion which you didn't hear from the home fans in this game.

'Coming to Manchester City with Dinamo Zagreb in the Champions League, you look at it as a top game, the game of your lives for some player.

'The quality of the City players, the stadium, the pitch. We expected a big game. It was a big game, yes, just a bit quiet! Not quite what we expected.'

Pep Guardiola has repeatedly expressed a wish for more noise to be generated at home games particularly on European nights when City's reputation suffers in comparison to Liverpool and Anfield. Before the 2-0 win against Zagreb, the manager called on his players to "seduce" the fans.

According to Pinto, it didn't work. 'We know about Anfield and all these famous English grounds and the atmosphere,' he said.

'City fans may have their reasons why they are louder for a Premier League match against another English team than in the Champions League. It was OK for us, it wasn't a problem that it was quiet, but that is how we found it.

In our stadium, City are still the big dog and we are the underdogs but with the passionate support we have, we can surprise them. Why not?'
description: A lack of atmosphere inside Manchester City's Etihad Stadium is becoming the talk of Europe after Dinamo Zagreb's Ivo Pinto poked fun at the lack of noise at the Etihad.
